title: Lotus 109
text: The Lotus 109 was a <a href="Formula%20One">Formula One</a> car used by <a href="Team%20Lotus">Team Lotus</a> in the latter part of the <a href="1994%20Formula%20One%20season">1994 Formula One season</a>. It was designed by <a href="Chris%20Murphy%20%28car%20designer%29">Chris Murphy</a> who based the car on his <a href="Lotus%20107">Lotus 107</a> model. The car featured sculptured sidepods, a shorter wheelbase, and a lower centre of gravity than its predecessor, whilst Mugen developed the engine to be lighter and higher-revving than the previous spec engine issued to the team. It was powered by a <a href="Mugen-Honda">Mugen-Honda</a> V10. <a href="Johnny%20Herbert">Johnny Herbert</a> was able to keep Lotus competitive in <a href="1994%20Belgian%20Grand%20Prix">Belgium</a> and <a href="1994%20Italian%20Grand%20Prix">Monza</a> with the car, but the funds were drying up and development was limited. At the end of the season, the car was retired and Team Lotus went into <a href="bankruptcy">receivership</a>.
